title: Basic Shapes and Colors

vocab.definition: A round shape with no corners
A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 corners
A shape with 3 sides and 3 corners
A shape with 4 sides and 4 corners, but not all sides are equal
The pointy parts where two sides of a shape meet
The straight lines that make up a shape

teachingNotes: Use shape manipulatives and real objects. Go on shape hunts around classroom. Create art with different shapes and colors.

sample.question: How many sides does a triangle have?
Point to the circle in this group of shapes.
Show me a square using your hands.
How many corners does a rectangle have?

truefalse.question: A circle has corners.
expectedAny: circles are round and have no corners

multiplechoice.question: Which shape has 4 equal sides?
expectedAny: squares have 4 sides that are all the same length

multiplechoice.question: What color do you get when you mix red and blue?

wordProblems.question: If you have 2 red circles and 3 blue squares, how many shapes do you have total?
You draw 4 triangles and 2 circles. How many shapes did you draw?
There are 5 red crayons and 3 blue crayons. How many crayons total?
You see 6 square windows. 2 are open. How many are closed?
Mom cuts 3 circular cookies and 4 square cookies. How many cookies total?

You have 7 blocks. 3 are squares and the rest are circles. How many circles?
